quizzes.title: Introduction to Machine Learning: Pre-Lecture Quiz

quiz.questionText: Applications of machine learning are all around us

answerOptions.answerText: deep learning is used in robots

quiz.questionText: Why might a business want to use ML strategies?

answerOptions.answerText: to automate the solving of multi-dimensional problems
to customize a shopping experience based on the type of customer

quiz.questionText: Machine learning algorithms are meant to simulate

answerOptions.answerText: learning ML is fun and accessible to everyone

quizzes.title: Fairness and Machine Learning: Pre-Lecture Quiz

quiz.questionText: Unfairness in Machine Learning can happen
The term 'unfairness' in ML connotes:

answerOptions.answerText: harms for a group of people
harms for the majority of people

quiz.questionText: The five main types of harms include

answerOptions.answerText: allocation, quality of service, stereotyping, denigration, and over- or under- representation
elocation, quality of service, stereotyping, denigration, and over- or under- representation
allocation, quality of service, stereophonics, denigration, and over- or under- representation

quizzes.title: Fairness and Machine Learning: Post-Lecture Quiz

quiz.questionText: Unfairness in a model can be caused by

answerOptions.answerText: too closely aligning to historical data

quiz.questionText: To mitigate unfairness, you can
Fairlearn is a package that can

answerOptions.answerText: compare multiple models by using fairness and performance metrics
choose the best model for your needs
help you decide what is fair and what is not

quiz.questionText: When building a model, you should:

answerOptions.answerText: prepare your data, then train your model
choose a training method, then prepare your data
tune parameters, then train your model

quiz.questionText: Your data's ___ will impact the quality of your ML model

answerOptions.answerText: a measurable property of your data

quiz.questionText: You should visualize your data because

answerOptions.answerText: you can discover potential cause for bias

answerOptions.answerText: Predicting the final exam marks of a student

quiz.questionText: Which of these Python modules is used to plot the visualization of data?

answerOptions.answerText: Incorporating a certain Machine Learning algorithm
Creating a pictorial representation of data using different plotting methods
Normalizing the values of a dataset

quizzes.title: Prepare and Visualize Data for Regression: Post-Lecture Quiz

quiz.questionText: Which of these code snippets is correct based on this lesson, if you want to check for the presence of missing values in your dataset? Suppose the dataset is stored in a variable named 'dataset' which is a Pandas DataFrame object.
Which of these plotting methods is useful when you would like to understand the spread of different groups of datapoints from your dataset?
What can Data Visualization NOT tell you?

answerOptions.answerText: The source from where the dataset is collected
Finding the presence of outliers in the dataset

Use Logistic Regression to predict

answerOptions.answerText: whether an apple is ripe or not

quiz.questionText: What are the tools we can use to host a pre-trained model on the web using Python?

answerOptions.answerText: Is this email spam or not?
What is the meaning of life?

quiz.questionText: What is the first step to using Classification techniques?

answerOptions.answerText: assigning a data point to a group or outcome

quiz.questionText: What is a multiclass question?

answerOptions.answerText: the task of classifying data points into multiple classes
the task of classifying data points into one of several classes
the task of cleaning data points in multiple ways

quiz.questionText: It's important to clean out recurrent or unhelpful data to help your classifiers solve your problem.
What's the best reason to balance your data?

answerOptions.answerText: Imbalanced data looks bad in visualizations
Balancing your data yields better results because an ML model won't skew towards one class
Balancing your data gives you more data points

quiz.questionText: Balanced, clean data yields the best classification results
How do you choose the right classifier?

answerOptions.answerText: Understand which classifiers work best for which scenarios

quiz.questionText: Classification is a type of

answerOptions.answerText: the person who double-checks your work
the algorithm to use in the optimization problem

quiz.questionText: Which classifier did we use in this lesson?

answerOptions.answerText: By checking the accuracy of its predictions
By checking it against other algorithms
By looking at historical data for how good this algorithm is at solving similar problems

answerOptions.answerText: a cluster's seed and its region

quiz.questionText: Using K-Means, you must first determine the value of 'k'

Alan Turing's 'Turing Test' tried to determine if a computer was

answerOptions.answerText: Analyzing the input and using machine intelligence

answerOptions.answerText: By feeding it more data and training it accordingly
The bot is dumb, it cannot learn :(

quiz.questionText: Tokenization

answerOptions.answerText: Splits text by means of punctuation

quiz.questionText: Embeddings

answerOptions.answerText: converts text data numerically so words can cluster

quiz.questionText: Parts-of-Speech Tagging

answerOptions.answerText: divides sentences by their parts of speech
takes tokenized words and tags them by their part of speech

quiz.questionText: Build a dictionary of how often words reoccur using:
N-grams refer to

answerOptions.answerText: A text can be split into sequences of words of a set length
A word can be split into sequences of characters of a set length
A text can be split into paragraphs of a set length

quiz.questionText: Sentiment analysis

answerOptions.answerText: analyzes a phrase for positivity or negativity

quiz.questionText: Naive translation
A *corpus* of texts refers to
If a ML model has enough human translations to build a model on, it can
Underlying TextBlob's translation library is:

answerOptions.answerText: apply Regression techniques to manually generated opinions and scores and look for patterns
apply NLP techniques to manually generated opinions and scores and look for patterns
apply Clustering techniques to manually generated opinions and scores and look for patterns

quiz.questionText: What information can we get from text that was written or spoken by a human?
What is sentiment analysis?

answerOptions.answerText: a study of whether a family heirloom has sentimental value
a method of systematically identifying, extracting, quantifying, and studying affective states and subjective information
the ability to tell whether someone is sad or happy

quiz.questionText: What question could be answered using a dataset of hotel reviews, Python, and sentiment analysis?

answerOptions.answerText: What are the most frequently used words and phrases in reviews?
Which resort has the best pool?
Is there valet parking at this hotel?

quiz.questionText: What is the essence of NLP?

answerOptions.answerText: categorizing human language into happy or sad
interpreting meaning or sentiment without having to have a human do it
finding outliers in sentiment and examining them

quiz.questionText: What are some things you might look for while cleaning data?
It is important to understand your data and its foibles before performing operations on it.
Why is it important to clean data before analyzing it?

answerOptions.answerText: Some columns might have missing or incorrect data
Messy data can lead to false conclusions about the dataset

quiz.questionText: What is one example of a strategy for cleaning data?

answerOptions.answerText: removing columns/rows that aren't useful for answering a specific question
getting rid of verified values that don't fit your hypothesis
moving the outliers to a separate table and running the calculations for that table to see if they match

quiz.questionText: It can be useful to categorize data using a Tag column.
What is the goal of the dataset?

answerOptions.answerText: to see how many negative and positive reviews there are for hotels across the world
to add sentiment and columns that will help you choose the best hotel
to analyze why people leave specific reviews

quiz.questionText: What are stop words?

answerOptions.answerText: common English words that do not change the sentiment of a sentence
words that you can remove to speed up sentiment analysis

quiz.questionText: To test the sentiment analysis, make sure it matches the reviewer's score for the same review.

quizzes.title: Intro to Time Series: Pre-Lecture Quiz

quiz.questionText: Time Series Forecasting is useful in
A time series is a sequence taken at:

answerOptions.answerText: successive equally spaced points in space
successive equally spaced points in time
successive equally spaced points in space and time

quiz.questionText: Time series can be used in:

quizzes.title: Intro to Time Series: Post-Lecture Quiz

quiz.questionText: Time series trends are

answerOptions.answerText: Measurable increases and decreases over time
Gaps between increases and decreases over time

quiz.questionText: Outliers are

answerOptions.answerText: points close to standard data variance
points far away from standard data variance

quiz.questionText: Time Series Forecasting is most useful for
ARIMA stands for
Stationarity refers to

answerOptions.answerText: data whose attributes does not change when shifted in time
data whose distribution does not change when shifted in time
data whose distribution changes when shifted in time

quiz.questionText: Differencing
ARIMA is used to make a model fit the special form of time series data
Use SARIMAX to
'Walk-Forward' validation involves

answerOptions.answerText: re-evaluating a model progressively as it is validated
re-training a model progressively as it is validated
re-configuring a model progressively as it is validated

quiz.questionText: What is reinforcement learning?

answerOptions.answerText: teaching someone something over and over again until they understand
a learning technique that deciphers the optimal behavior of an agent in some environment by running many experiments
understanding how to run multiple experiments at once

quiz.questionText: What is a policy?

answerOptions.answerText: a function that returns the action at any given state
a document that tells you whether or not you can return an item
a function that is used for a random purpose

quiz.questionText: A reward function returns a score for each state of an environment.
What is Q-Learning?

answerOptions.answerText: a mechanism for recording the 'goodness' of each state
an algorithm where the policy is defined by a Q-Table

quiz.questionText: For what values does a Q-Table correspond to the random walk policy?
It was better to use exploration than exploitation during the learning process in our lesson.
Chess and Go are games with continuous states.
What is the CartPole problem?

answerOptions.answerText: a method for optimizing your shopping cart

quiz.questionText: What tool can we use to play out different scenarios of potential states in a game?
Where do we define all possible actions in an environment?
What pair did we use as the dictionary key-value?

answerOptions.answerText: (state, action) as the key, Q-Table entry as the value
state as the key, action as the value
the value of the qvalues function as the key, action as the value

quiz.questionText: What are the hyperparameters we used during Q-Learning?

answerOptions.answerText: q-table value, current reward, random action
learning rate, discount factor, exploration/exploitation factor
cumulative rewards, learning rate, exploration factor

quiz.questionText: What's an example of an ML application in the Finance industry?

answerOptions.answerText: Personalizing the customer journey using NLP

answerOptions.answerText: Motion sensing of animals using classifiers

quiz.questionText: SVM stands for
Which of these ML techniques is used to predict continuous values?
Which of these models is popularly used for time series forecasting?

answerOptions.answerText: Finding the best fit hyperplane that has the maximum number of data points
Learning the probability distribution of the dataset

quiz.questionText: What is the purpose of a kernel in SVMs?

answerOptions.answerText: To measure the accuracy of the model predictions
To transform the dataset to a higher dimension space
To standardize the values of the dataset
